summary: This is a brief email from the defense team submitting letter oppositions regarding co-conspirator statements and evidence designation (GX 52) to the Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York. It appears to be procedural legal correspondence in the Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations.context: Address of the Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office where the correspondence is sent.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 15, 2021, from the defense team to the prosecution.
The defense submitted brief letter oppositions on topics related to co-conspirator statements and evidence designation (GX 52).
The correspondence is addressed to the Assistant United States Attorney at the Southern District of New York.
The document references Federal Rule of Evidence 801(d)(2)(e), which governs the admissibility of co-conspirator statements.
This appears to be procedural legal maneuvering in the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell case litigation.
